thread.title: 'Gary from Chicago' released from jail 3 days before Oscars
thread.title_full: 'Gary from Chicago' released from jail 3 days before Oscars

title: 'Gary from Chicago' released from jail 3 days before Oscars
text:
'Gary from Chicago' released from jail 3 days before Oscars Published February 28, 2017 Facebook 0 Twitter 0 Email Print 
"Gary from Chicago" kisses the hand of actor Nicole Kidman during a skit at the 89th Annual Academy Awards. (Reuters) 
The tourist who became a breakout star of the 89th Annual Academy Awards said he was released from prison, where he served 20 years, just three days before the appearing at the Oscars. 
"Gary from Chicago," whose real name is Gary Alan Coe, was part of a sightseeing tour group who unexpectedly ended up at the Oscars as part of a skit organized by host Jimmy Kimmel. 
Donning a Hollywood sweatshirt and black baseball cap, Coe's at-ease attitude quickly made him a standout star of the Oscars skit. 
NICOLE KIDMAN ROASTED ON SOCIAL MEDIA FOR STRANGE CLAPPING AT OSCARS 
Coe spoke with ABC7 about his experience at the Oscars. 
"Change is possible," Coe said. "It's a sad day to be in prison for 20 years and not be able to be a dad, granddad to your children. You know what my son told me today, man, and I almost [came] to tears. He said he's proud of me. So to hear your children say that they're proud of me means the world to me." 
Coe, who said he served 20 years for multiple felonies, also revealed that he found God and his fiancee Vickie Vines while serving time. Advertisement
